name: Introduction to Computer Science
description: This course introduces students to the principles of computer science. Students will learn about algorithms, data structures, programming languages, paradigms, software development, computer architecture, operating systems, databases, networking, security, and ethical issues in computing.

name: Data Structures and Algorithms
description: This course covers the design, implementation, analysis, and optimization of data structures and algorithms. Students will learn about arrays, linked lists, stacks, queues, trees, graphs, sorting, searching, recursion, dynamic programming, and complexity theory.

name: Discrete Mathematics
description: This course covers the mathematical foundations of computer science. Students will learn about logic, set theory, functions, relations, combinatorics, graph theory, and formal languages.

name: Logic and Computation
description: This course covers the logical foundations of computer science. Students will learn about propositional and predicate logic, inference rules, proof techniques, formal semantics, and applications to programming languages and automated reasoning.

name: Operating Systems
description: This course covers the principles of operating systems. Students will learn about process management, memory management, file systems, input/output management, and concurrency control.

name: Computer Networks
description: This course covers the principles of computer networks. Students will learn about layered architectures, protocols, performance analysis, security and privacy issues, and emerging trends in networking.

name: Database Systems
description: This course covers the principles of database systems. Students will learn about data models, relational algebra, SQL, transaction management, concurrency control, and database designs.

name: Automata and Formal Languages
description: This course covers the theoretical foundations of computer science. Students will learn about automata, grammars, regular expressions, context-free languages, and computability theory.

name: Compiler Design
description: This course covers the principles of compiler design. Students will learn about lexical and syntactic analysis, parsing, code generation, optimization, and interpreter and virtual machine designs.

name: Computer Graphics
description: This course covers the principles of computer graphics. Students will learn about raster and vector graphics, geometric transformations, shading models, rendering techniques, and applications in computer games, animation, and virtual reality.

name: Artificial Intelligence
description: This course covers the principles of artificial intelligence. Students will learn about search algorithms, knowledge representation, reasoning, planning, machine learning, natural language processing, and robotics.
